document.title: An Environmental Library System
document.abstract: An environmental library system (ELS) for the United States Department of Housing and Urban Development has been developed and installed in six HUD offices to bring together all nationwide and local environmental source materials in an information system with accompanying manuals indicating how to use the various sources needed to answer environmental questions comprise one of the basic elements of the system, which also includes question guides, the collection itself, and a card catalog.
document.publication-title: School of Information Sciences -- Faculty Publications and Other Works

field.name: custom_citation
field.value: Carol Tenopir and Pamela Cibbarelli. “An Environmental Library System.” Presented at the Special Libraries Association Annual Meeting, Kansas City, MO: June 1978. ERIC Fiche ED165737. 23p.
